terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized platform that organizes, stores, and controls access to documents, enabling version control, collaboration, and automated workflows
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents over time, maintaining historical versions and ensuring teams work with the most current information
A chronological record of document changes, access, and activities that provides accountability and compliance verification during inspections
A centralized location where all authoritative and up-to-date information is stored, eliminating conflicting or duplicate data across systems
A security method that restricts document access and editing permissions based on a user's role or responsibilities within an organization
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization
An automated sequence of tasks, approvals, and processes that documents must follow from creation to final approval and publication
The process of connecting different software systems through their APIs to enable seamless data exchange and synchronized operations
Pre-designed document formats that provide consistent structure and formatting for specific types of compliance or technical documentation
System-generated notifications that inform users of document updates, regulatory changes, or required actions without manual intervention
A feature that allows multiple users to simultaneously edit and comment on documents in real-time with tracked changes
The process of ensuring that information remains consistent and up-to-date across multiple connected systems and platforms
Formal records and documents that demonstrate adherence to regulatory standards, industry requirements, and legal obligations
A centralized digital storage system that organizes and maintains collections of documents with search and retrieval capabilities
